timeline.message: Move old dtos, add UserDto for Identity Service
Add password check dtos and nicer examples

timeline.bodyText: This is taken from the documentation, but I think it is a little unspecific. Could we put something more descriptive here and also for the next property?
timeline.author: yT0n1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,17 @@
+<@lib.dto desc = "Describes a rule of a password policy.">
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "placeholder"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "A placeholder string that can be used to display an internationalized message to the user."

timeline.bodyText: I think this might be overly specific. It is also brittle if the properties change at some point. It is also a bit redundant, because, the dto has its own description which the user can read.
timeline.author: yT0n1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+<@lib.dto>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "password"
+        type = "string"
+        desc = "The candidate password to be check against the password policy."
+    />
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "profile"
+        type = "ref"
+        dto = "UserProfileDto"
+        last = true
+        desc = "A JSON object containing variable key-value pairs. The object contains the following properties:

timeline.author: yanavasileva
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,18 @@
+<@lib.dto>
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "groups"
+        type = "array"
+        dto = "IdentityServiceGroupDto"
+        desc = "An array of group objects."
+    />
+
+    <@lib.property
+        name = "name"

timeline.bodyText: The response dto based on the Rest API is PasswordPolicyDto that contains a List ofPasswordPolicyRuleDto
timeline.author: yanavasileva
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,73 @@
+<#-- Generated From File: camunda-docs-manual/public/reference/rest/identity/get-password-policy/index.html -->
+{
+  <@lib.endpointInfo
+      id = "getPasswordPolicy"
+      tag = "Identity"
+      summary = "Get Password Policy"
+      desc = "A password policy consists of a list of rules that new passwords must follow to be
+              policy compliant. This end point returns a JSON representation of the
+              list of policy rules. More information on password policies in Camunda can be found in the password policy
+              [user guide](${docsUrl}/user-guide/process-engine/password-policy/) and in
+              the [security instructions](${docsUrl}/user-guide/security/)."
+  />
+
+  "responses": {
+
+    <@lib.response
+        code = "200"
+        dto = "PasswordPolicyRuleDto"

timeline.bodyText: Document in the ticket and comment here that the inheritance in Rest API is different
timeline.author: yanavasileva

replies.bodyText: Actually, that's an oversight on my part. It should inherit.
replies.author: yT0n1
